Methods

addField(collection, field, value) → {Collection}

add a field to a collection. This is an immutable function. It creates a new collection but does not modify the original collection
Parameters:
Name Type Description
collection Collection data collection
field string name of new field
value function | Array either an array to use as the data or a function that accepts the record as first argument
Source:
  • add-field.js, line 10
Throws:
[[Description]]
Type
Error
Returns:
the original collection with the added field
Type
Collection

boxPlot(groupField, dataField, layout) → {HTML}

Display an HTML boxplot using the plotly library
Parameters:
Name Type Description
groupField string | number | function Field specifying the groups - will appear on the X axis. See column function for possible values
dataField string | number | function The field containing the numerical data represented within the box (Y axis)
layout object layout for the diagram
Source:
  • boxplot.js, line 12
Returns:
HTML wrapper with the HTML used to display the boxplot
Type
HTML

column(fields) → {Array}

Extract a column or columns from a data collection. The behavior of the function depends on the type of the fields argument:
  • string - treat it as field name
  • number - treat it as index
  • function - Call the function for each object with the object as first argument - similar to map function
  • Array - Each returned element in the array is an array. The input array elements can be string, number or function
    • Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    fields string | number | Array | function as described in the description
    Source:
    • column.js, line 11
    Returns:
    Type
    Array

    corrmap(layout) → {HTML}

    generate a correlation matrix using plotly heat maps. This visualization can be used to easily evaluate the correlation between several fields. It takes all numerical fields in the data collection and checks the correlation between each field and all other fields.
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    layout object additional layout properties, passed on to the plotly function
    Source:
    • corrmap.js, line 11
    Returns:
    HTML wrapper of the generated diagram

    describe(data) → {Collection}

    Calculate basic distribution measures of a field in a data collection. the measures include count, mean, standard deviation, min value, max value and quartiles. Each measure is a separate object with properties measure (name of measure) and value (value of the measure).
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    data string field name
    Source:
    • describe.js, line 10
    Returns:
    Collection of distribution measures
    Type
    Collection

    do(func) → {Object}

    Run a function receiving the collection data as its first argument. This is useful when chaining several functions and there is a need for customized operation in the midst of the chain
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    func function The function to execute in the form of func(data)
    Source:
    • do.js, line 7
    Returns:
    The input wrapped data
    Type
    Object

    dropEqual(field, value) → {Collection}

    Drop data objects that their field equals the value or any object in the value when the value is an array. The field argument can be a field name, index or function in the form of func(dataObject). Values are compared using strict comparison operator. This function is immutable - it returns the collection excluding the dropped items. It does not modify the original data collection
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    field number | string | function the field to query
    value any the value to compare
    Source:
    • drop-equal.js, line 10
    Returns:
    collection of input data objects excluding the dropped items
    Type
    Collection

    dropStopwords(field) → {Collection}

    Drop stopwords from a collection. If the field is specified, The collection of stopwords is compared to the field value. Otherwise, The collection is treated as a collection of strings, not objects.
    Parameters:
    Name Type Default Description
    field string | number | function 'this' the field spec - as in the column function
    Source:
    • drop-stopwords.js, line 10
    Returns:
    The collection of data objects excluding the stopwords
    Type
    Collection

    filterEqual(data, field, value) → {Collection}

    Filter all data elements where their field value equals value or is included in value array
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    data Collection input collection
    field string field name
    value Object | Array.<Object> value to select or an array of possible values
    Source:
    • filter-equal.js, line 9
    Returns:
    Subset of input collection where the field equals or included in value
    Type
    Collection

    groupBy(groupField, groupFunctions) → {Collection}

    Group a data collection by a group field. The return value is a collection of objects with a property key representing the group value and a property data with all data objects included in the group. In addition, the groupFunctions object is a dictionary from property name to a function calculating a group function. For each collection and each group function a property is added to the group object with the property being the groupFunctions property name and the value is the return value from the groupFunctions function. The function is in the form of func(collection) receiving as its first argument an array with all data objects belonging to the group
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    groupField string | number | function field spec as in column function
    groupFunctions object An object mapping property names and the function used to calcualte the property.
    Source:
    • group-by.js, line 11
    Returns:
    A collection of groups with property key equals the group item and property data with an array of all data objects belonging to the group
    Type
    Collection

    loadCSV(path, options) → {Collection}

    Load a csv file. The file can either be on the local file system or a url path. By default, the first line is used as column names. This function uses the csv module and the options are documented there. By default, the following options are set to true: auto_parse, auto_parse_date, trim, columns.
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    path string path to file location or url of the CSV document
    options object options as documented here
    Source:
    • load-csv.js, line 23
    Returns:
    A collection of data objects loaded from the CSV document
    Type
    Collection
